subject: Sleep
title: Critical Periods and Sleep
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Critical Periods and Sleep.

hook.text: Kittens deprived of visual input in one eye during a critical period never develop vision in that eye.

buildup.text: Critical periods are windows when the brain is especially plastic and experience shapes permanent wiring.

discovery.text: Sleep is essential during critical periods. Visual cortex rewiring happens primarily during sleep, not while awake.

twist.text: Depriving kittens of sleep during the critical period prevents visual development even with normal visual input.

climax.text: This is why infants and children need so much sleep. Their brains are in permanent construction mode.

punchline.text: Young brains need sleep to wire themselves correctly.

quiz.question: Why is sleep critical during developmental critical periods?
options: Brain rewiring happens primarily during sleep
